bookTitle: St. Francis of Assisi: Passion, Poverty and the Man who Transformed the Catholic Church

questions.question: San Damiano was dedicated to which saints?
distractors: Saints Peter and Paul
Saints Francis and Clare
Saints Benedict and Scholastica
Saints Anthony and Francis
Saints Dominic and Thomas

questions.question: What architectural features did San Damiano have?
questions.correctAnswer: Low ceilings, broad round arches and thick walls
distractors: Beautiful flying buttresses
Soaring Gothic spires
Ornate stained glass windows
Tall marble columns
Grand vaulted ceilings

questions.question: What was the condition of San Damiano and its community when Francis began visiting?
questions.correctAnswer: It was neglected and in disrepair
distractors: It had a vibrant community led by Fr. Peter
It was being renovated by local craftsmen
It was closed and abandoned completely
It was full of pilgrims visiting daily
It was well-maintained by Benedictine monks

questions.question: What captivated Francis inside San Damiano even though there were not beautiful stained-glass windows or soaring spires?
distractors: An ancient altar of marble
A statue of the Virgin Mary
The peaceful silence
The simple stone architecture
A relic of Saint Damian

questions.question: In the beginning, why was Francis religious?
distractors: Because his mother taught him to pray
Because he had a deep personal faith
Because he feared God's judgment
Because he wanted to become a priest
Because of his encounter with lepers

questions.question: What did Francis realize about God as he gazed at the crucifix and reflected on the connection between Jesus' suffering and his own?
distractors: God was angry at him for his sins
God demanded perfect obedience
God was distant and unknowable
God required great sacrifices
God only loved the righteous

questions.question: What did Francis' dream in Spoleto encourage him to do?
distractors: Return to his father's business
Rebuild the churches of Assisi
Care for the lepers
Become a hermit
Preach to the townspeople

questions.question: What did Francis recognize about Christ's gift through his sacrifice on the cross?
questions.correctAnswer: Christ took all sins onto himself through the Cross
distractors: Christ's sacrifice required human repentance to be effective
Christ's gift was only for those who lived righteously
Christ's death proved God's anger toward sin
Christ's suffering was a model Francis must imitate perfectly
Christ's sacrifice was payment for past sins only

questions.question: What conclusion did Francis reach about God's ability to forgive?
questions.correctAnswer: God forgave through Christ in order to free people for a much greater experience of love
distractors: God forgave only after proper penance was completed
God's forgiveness required years of faithful service
God forgave but still punished for past sins
God's forgiveness was limited to certain sins
God forgave conditionally based on future behavior

questions.question: How was Francis being transformed through his encounter with God in the crucifix at San Damiano?
questions.correctAnswer: His heart came alive with a burning, consuming love; the sense of separation from God and others began to leave him; he began to feel a oneness with God; the sense of inner shame and sinfulness began to leave him; his awareness of sin caused him to place all his faith and reliance on God; he was filling and reforming his sinful soul with God's grace; he began to experience grace and peace
distractors: He became more disciplined in following religious rules and regulations
He developed a fear of sin and punishment that motivated him to be better
He gained knowledge of theology and scripture
He became determined to prove his worthiness to God through good works
He learned to control his emotions and desires through willpower
